meanings.definition: Invent or concoct (something), typically with deceitful intent.
meanings.sent1: He tried to fabricate an excuse for being late to school.
meanings.sent2: The criminal attempted to fabricate an alibi for the night of the robbery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child decided to fabricate a story about a magical unicorn.
meanings.sent4: Her elaborate plan to fabricate evidence fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The detective knew the suspect was trying to fabricate a false identity.

meanings.definition: Construct or manufacture (something) by assembling parts or material.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will fabricate a new bookshelf for the library.
meanings.sent2: The company fabricates cars using advanced machinery.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to fabricate a miniature city out of cardboard.
meanings.sent4: She was able to fabricate a beautiful dress from scratch.
meanings.sent5: The artist can fabricate stunning sculptures from various materials.
